channel.title: Attack training
channel.description:
I'm looking for a good place to train attack. I have 85 attack, 85 str and 82 defence and im going for 99 attack.
Also, could you add an estimate at how long it would take for 99 in that location, playing 10 hours a day from 85? Much appreciated.

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:31, topic:439067”]hardest thing is shit like waterfields if you don’t have a cmaul. aquanites are dicks so don’t bother buying them.[/quote]Aquanites are actually good if you have non shit agility (81 for shortcut) and soulsplit. You can just tank them in regular gear and soul split. The profit is worth it, as ranging ammys are still 500k-ish each, and you generally get 2 or 3 of them in one task, sometimes more.

Tldr it is easy money

Read full topic

item.description:

apocalypsePK:

bot with me or if not come play wow with me

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

If you want it extremely fast then you need to do the suggestions like armored zombies or bandits.

If you want to earn it semi-fast and earn a nice profit while doing it, do Slayer. On my account I trained all of my combats by Slayer. Slayer also tends to keep you much more entertained.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

I don’t tend to play that long, but I can do if needed. I just want 99 attack the fastest.

Read full topic

No, legitly training.

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:31, topic:439067”]hardest thing is shit like waterfields if you don’t have a cmaul. aquanites are dicks so don’t bother buying them.[/quote]Waterfiends are easy with an ancient staff.

AN ANCIENT STAFF. If slaying is seriously too slow bring dreadnips. I can get ~120 kills in a trip using them without soulsplit.

Read full topic

hardest thing is shit like waterfields if you don’t have a cmaul. aquanites are dicks so don’t bother buying them.

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

Pink Phat:

Technically speaking, slayer is not very good exp for a certain skill at all. Yes, it levels 3 skills at once while gaining quite a profit, but not all the task are to be approched with melee. Plus, I do not have alot of money at all. How am I going to fork out on potions every time I get a difficult task?

unless you’re 100% shit at the game, you don’t even find a “hard” task too often

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Pink Phat, post:25, topic:439067”]Technically speaking, slayer is not very good exp for a certain skill at all. Yes, it levels 3 skills at once while gaining quite a profit, but not all the task are to be approched with melee. Plus, I do not have alot of money at all. How am I going to fork out on potions every time I get a difficult task?[/quote]This is where power slaying comes into play. I have enough points to skip any task i want at any time, and still make up for it because most tasks i get are excellent (Greater Demons, Hellhounds, Bloodvelds, Iron/Steel Dragons, Fire giants, Gargoyles, Abyssal Demons etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Darkmeyer is still one of the best options imo. You’d be stuck using a blisterwood staff to train attack (polearm does aggressive, defensive and controlled), but then you could use a shield/defender and speed it up a tiny bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @mr_extremez mr extremez
item.description:
@mr_extremez wrote:

I do bandits so i can semi afk them.

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

Pink Phat:

Technically speaking, slayer is not very good exp for a certain skill at all. Yes, it levels 3 skills at once while gaining quite a profit, but not all the task are to be approched with melee. Plus, I do not have alot of money at all. How am I going to fork out on potions every time I get a difficult task?

lol? All tasks are approachable with melee, it just might not be the best style to use for the monster. Anyway, I also suggest slayer, then just block or skip any tasks that are junk like waterfiends.

Or another way to do it is train it SUOMI style, at skeletons in ape toll dungeon.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:

Plus, I do not have alot of money at all. How am I going to fork out on potions every time I get a difficult task?

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @_Coded ..::Coded::..
item.description:
@_Coded wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:23, topic:439067”][quote author=Pink Phat link=topic=541769.msg3968990#msg3968990 date=1333995820]

I originally maxed combat on spiders and bandits, which turned out to be a bad mistake I now regret

It’s far better to train combat with slayer, it’s usually pretty fast experience and you’re killing two birds with one stone.

I understand how it kills two birds with one stone, but for this moment in time I just want 99 attack. I can always do slayer for 99 strength and defence, and still make quite a profit and alot of slayer exp.

Aswell, how long do you estimate it would take me from 85-99 attack doing bandits on a 10 hour a day basis?
[/quote]I hope you do realize that you won’t be 99 slayer even if you get 99 att/str/def completely through it. That would get you to 94-95 at best.[/quote]

If you use all of your slayer points on xp then you could prob get 99

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:

I originally maxed combat on spiders and bandits, which turned out to be a bad mistake I now regret

It’s far better to train combat with slayer, it’s usually pretty fast experience and you’re killing two birds with one stone.
[/quote]
I understand how it kills two birds with one stone, but for this moment in time I just want 99 attack. I can always do slayer for 99 strength and defence, and still make quite a profit and alot of slayer exp.

Aswell, how long do you estimate it would take me from 85-99 attack doing bandits on a 10 hour a day basis?[/quote]I hope you do realize that you won’t be 99 slayer even if you get 99 att/str/def completely through it. That would get you to 94-95 at best.

Read full topic

item.title: Attack training
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Pink Phat:

All I want is attack experience. Which ever gives the most of that, I want.

slayer because you can utilize DPS increasing equipment (black mask, etc). this in turn provides the greatest xp/hr rewards for combat.

Read full topic
